title: William Ruto's Govt Secures Jobs in Saudi Arabia for Kenyans, Monthly Salary
text: Kenya Govt Announces Jobs in Saudi Arabia for Kenyans, Monthly Salary - President William Ruto promised to secure jobs abroad for thousands of unemployed Kenyans - The Ministry of Labour and Social Protection announced jobs in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (KSA) for professional Kenyans in the field of nursing and personal/healthcare assistance - Qualified candidates will be paid a salary range of between KSh 92,000 to KSh 146,000 based on the job category [PAY ATTENTION: We Need your Opinion! The government has announced job opportunities in Saudi Arabia for Kenyans. This followed President William Ruto's visit to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (KSA) in November 2023. How many abroad jobs did Ruto secure? The head of state revealed that he had secured an agreement with the Saudi Arabian government to [export 2,500 skilled labourers](https://www.tuko.co.ke/kenya/531485-william-ruto-claims-s-secured-2500-jobs-kenyans-saudi-arabia-na-mshahara-ni-mnono/). PAY ATTENTION: Celebrate Kenyan changemakers with TUKO.co.ke! [Read more about BUSINESS LEADERS AWARDS 2023](https://kenyan-business-leaders-tuko-award.webflow.io/) In a public notice released on Tuesday, January 2, the Ministry of Labour and Social Protection called for applications for Kenyans to work in KSA nursing and personal healthcare sectors. "...we request for applications from qualified Kenyans for employment in the KSA as General Nurses and Personal Assistant/Healthcare Assistant professionals," read the notice signed by Labour PS Shadrack Mwadime in part. What are the nursing job requirements? Mwadime specified that applicants should be Kenyan citizens, female, and aged between 22 and 35 years. They should be registered and licensed members of the Nursing Council of Kenya with good standing. Those with a degree should have a minimum of two years of continuous experience, while diploma holders should have zero experience (graduate entry is accepted). [Certificate in nursing](https://www.tuko.co.ke/348721-certificate-nursing-kenya-requirements-colleges-offering-fees.html) graduates should have a minimum of one year of continuous work experience. Qualified candidates must be proficient in English, both writing and speaking, physically fit and hold a valid [Kenyan passport](https://www.tuko.co.ke/268978-kenyan-passport-tracking.html). They must have a valid and latest licence or employment certificate. What is the monthly salary for a nurse in Saudi? Once selected, the applicants must have valid prometric test results, which can be taken in [Kenya](https://kiswahili.tuko.co.ke/tags/siasa-za-kenya/) of KSA with a fee deducted from the salary in three instalments. The job terms are [pegged on a contract of two years](https://www.tuko.co.ke/business-economy/526301-william-ruto-promises-kenyans-350000-jobs-saudi-arabia-wamesema-mko-na-bidii-mjipange/), renewable. Workers have eight hours on duty with a monthly pay of 2,200 riyals (KSh 92,000) for certificate holders. Diploma holders earn a monthly salary of 3,000 riyals (KSh 125,000) while degree holders earn 3,500 riyals (KSh 146,000). Source: TUKO.co.ke
